meanings.sent1: She had to refasten her shoelaces before going for a run.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, he refastened the loose roof tiles to prevent leaks.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel kept refastening the acorns in the tree, playing a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like it was refastening itself after seeing her smile.

meanings.definition: The act of securing something again.
meanings.sent1: The refastening of the lock made her feel safer in the house.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the refastening of the seatbelt before the car started moving.
meanings.sent3: The refastening of the friendship bracelet symbolized their bond growing stronger.
meanings.sent4: The refastening of the bandage on his arm was a reminder of his recent injury.
meanings.sent5: The refastening of the tent flap kept the bugs out during the camping trip.
